senses.sense_definition: A letter or group of letters added to the beginning of a word to change its meaning.

examples.text: You can change the meaning of the word by adding a negative <w>prefix</w>.
The <w>prefix</w> 're-' usually indicates that an action is being repeated.

senses.sense_definition: A set of numbers placed before a telephone number to indicate the region or country.

examples.text: You need to dial the country <w>prefix</w> if you are calling from abroad.
Numbers with the 0800 <w>prefix</w> are usually free to call.

senses.sense_definition: A title added before a person's name, such as Mr., Dr., or Mrs.

examples.text: Please select the appropriate <w>prefix</w> for your name on the form.
He prefers to use the <w>prefix</w> 'Doctor' in professional settings.

senses.sense_definition: An initial segment of a string of characters.

examples.text: The algorithm checks if the string contains a specific <w>prefix</w>.
In this code, 'abra' is a <w>prefix</w> of the word 'abracadabra'.

senses.sense_definition: To place something at the beginning of a word, phrase, or identifier.

examples.text: The author <w>prefixed</w> the chapter with a short quotation.
You should <w>prefix</w> the variable name with an underscore to indicate it is private.

senses.sense_definition: To determine or set something in advance.

examples.text: They <w>prefixed</w> a day for the final meeting.
Fate seemed to have <w>prefixed</w> the limits of his ambition.
